body.section: Hierarchy BloodPressureDiastolicEndpoint is a kind of ObservationQualifier

section.title: Description
section.p: Of the five sounds defined by Korotkof early in the 20th century, there has been disagreement on whether diastolic pressure should be measured at phase IV (muffling of sound) or phase V (disappearance of sound). In some patients, the measurements can differ significantly. In cases where the distinction is significant, local policy may specify one point or the other: in at least these cases, and potentially all, the phase, or "end point," at which the measurement is taken should be recorded. - Adapted from Practical Management of Hypertension (Birkenhäger, ed.); ABC of Hypertension (Beevers et al); The 5-minute Pediatric Consult (Schwartz, ed).
This class records an observation of the phase at which the diastolic pressure was measured.

stentry.p: This property defines what was observed that “qualifies” the primary, or “owning” Observation. This property defines what was observed by citing a value from a nationally recognized coding system. In this case, the value will hard-coded to a LOINC or SNOMED code that represents the concept of Diastolic End Point.

This property contains the result, or value of the qualifying Observation. In the generic Observation Qualifier class, the data type for this property can be anything. In this sub-type, the value is constrained to be one of a set of codes from the SNOMED-CT coding system that represent the Diastolic Endpoint observed.
